text: - Hello, and welcome to Community Chats.
I'm Aley Hammer, and today,
we're interviewing Desmond Hang,
the cofounder and CEO from Carbar.

Des, what actually inspired
you to start Carbar,

and can you share with
our audience a little bit
about your business?

- Yeah, sure. Thanks, Aley,
for having me on the show.

So for me, it has been a
lifelong passion for cars,

and that's the main reason
why I started Carbar itself,
so coupling my experience

around digital industry
and my passion for cars,
that's really what started my motivation
to found a company like Carbar.
So for me, my first car was a Subaru,
and it's been quite a journey
from owning that first car
to having that lifelong experience
around how do we manage a vehicle?

And I've traded up, and
in my earlier years,
I've been trading vehicles as well,

so I kinda understand from a
customer pain point perspective
how does all that work.

So I founded Carbar in
2016, like I mentioned,
and the aim was to be the world's most
trusted automotive retailer.

So we are building an
ecosystem of services

that offer a better way for
consumers and businesses
to access and manage their mobility needs.

So in essence, we do have a
broader marketplace proposition

so that people can come
and access that vehicle.
In our early formative years,

we established ourselves
as a virtual dealership.
We understood that people needed the time
and needed the ability for them
to really try out the vehicle.
So there was a challenging portions
of our business where we could not...
We had to entice people to really pay
for their vehicles completely online.

So we worked out a way
by which a subscription

could alleviate that
stress point around that,
and to be able to chart downpayments
to allow people to do so seamlessly.
- Thanks so much for sharing, and Des,
you mentioned it before, no pun intended,

but what is driving the move
to your subscription model
that you just spoke about,

instead of that old-school
car ownership model?
And what are the benefits, actually,
of a subscription model?
- So for us, we see subscription very much

as the ability for our customers
to have the flexibility
and the ability to contain all car costs
to a weekly repayment.

So that's the primary
driver for subscription.

However, we do think that
it's a matter of access
versus ownership side of things,
so for people, it ranges

from the ability for them
to access that vehicle
all the way through to actually owning,
and also having a piece of equity
within the vehicle itself.

So what many people don't
know about our business
is that it has, like I mentioned,

from our formative years, we
have multiple facets to it.

So we do wholesale vehicles,
we do retail vehicles,

we also, at the core of
it, subscribe vehicles.

So during 2019, when IAG
invested in our business,

we made a conscious
decision to make Carbar

synonymous with car
subscription, so really,

that's what we've done in
the broader marketplace.

- Well, it's great that
you've got so many options

for customers' preferences
and changing circumstances.
And I wanted to ask you,

what's actually involved
in subscribing to Carbar?
Can you describe the process a little bit
for someone who doesn't know?
- Yeah, sure.

So unlike traditional
ways of accessing cars,

you can shop a range of
vehicles and subscribe a car
completely online in a matter of minutes.

So there's hundreds of
vehicles that's provided
as choice and selection for our customers.
So it's as easy as providing documentation
for your identification.
We do a quick affordability check
to ensure that you can actually afford it,

and there's a small
upfront commitment fee,

which then subsequently
kicks in the process
for us to actually purchase the vehicle
on behalf of the subscribers,

and then putting it through
our subscription program.

So that way Carbar is in
full control of the vehicle,

we are actually managing
it on your behalf,

and then you have peace of
mind that someone's actually
looking out for your well-being.

- Wow, that sounds like a
really quick and easy process.

And Des, I wanted to ask
you a little bit about why

you chose to build the
Carbar platform in the cloud,

and what actually is
the benefit of using AWS

for both your business, but
also your customers as well?

- Yeah, so we're a
startup/scale-up business,
so we do need to move quickly,
have the confidence in the partner
that provides the platform features,
as well as functions that are easy to use.
So configurability, as well as the ability
to help us grow as business,
was very much front of mind for us,

and also, the ability for
us to scale up our overheads
and not have a massive impact upfront,

that was important for what
we chose within the partner.
So AWS was selected as the ability
for us to really scale our business

with the enriched features
that you guys have,

and our ability to work
with our tech team,

as well as to build extensibility
for our tech platform.
So this meant that we could actually focus
on what we do best,
and that's on the customer side of things,

and also working with
partners that can actually
build on top of AWS as a platform.
- Thanks for sharing, Des,
and finally, to wrap up this interview,
what does the future look like
for the subscription car market,
and what's your vision for Carbar?
And I also really wanna know,

do you have any new products
that you're planning

on releasing in the near future
that you can tell us about?
- Yeah, so for us, you know,

the average car Australia
is 10-plus years,

so following on from our
discussions with ANCAP,

it's a key vision for
us to be able to really
increase the safety of people in vehicles.
So, like I mentioned,

we wanna be the most world's
trusted automotive retailer,
with all the uncertainty around EVs
and the pace of technology,
so we see subscription as an affordable,
flexible alternative to drive EV adoption.
So at the end of the day,

if customers love and
want to own their EVs,
and because we own that asset,
we can seamlessly transition across
to a financing product for them.

- Des, thank you so much for
coming on the show today.
If anyone has any questions,
please pop in the comment section below,
and we'll get back to you.
Thanks, Des!
- Thank you, thanks.
